meta.name: Tizaz (The Commandments)
meta.description: The second book of the Ethiopic New Testament Church Order, containing the ethical mandates for the faithful.

verses.text: There are two ways in this world: one of life and one of death; and there is a great difference between these two ways.
The way of life is this: First, thou shalt love God who made thee; and second, thy neighbor as thyself.
And all things whatsoever thou wouldst not should be done to thee, do thou also not to another.
Thou shalt not kill; thou shalt not commit adultery; thou shalt not corrupt the youth; thou shalt not commit fornication.
Thou shalt not steal; thou shalt not practice magic; thou shalt not use sorcery; thou shalt not kill a child by abortion, nor slay that which is born.
Thou shalt not covet the things of thy neighbor; thou shalt not forswear thyself; thou shalt not bear false witness.
Thou shalt not be double-minded nor double-tongued, for to be double-tongued is a snare of death.
Thy speech shall not be false, nor empty, but filled with the power of the Spirit.
Thou shalt not be avaricious, nor a plunderer, nor a hypocrite, nor ill-tempered, nor proud.
My child, flee from every evil and from everything like unto it.
Be not prone to anger, for anger leadeth to murder; neither be jealous, nor contentious, nor passionate; for out of all these murders are engendered.
Be thou meek, for the meek shall inherit the earth.
My child, him that speaketh to thee the word of God, thou shalt remember night and day, and thou shalt honor him as the Lord.
For in the place where the glory of the Lord is spoken of, there the Lord is.
Seek out daily the faces of the saints, that thou mayest find rest in their words.
Thou shalt not create schism, but thou shalt pacify them that contend.
Thou shalt not stretch out thy hands to receive and shut them when it cometh to giving.
If thou hast anything in thy hands, thou shalt give a ransom for thy sins; thou shalt not hesitate to give, nor murmur when thou givest.
Thou shalt not take away thy hand from thy son or from thy daughter, but from their youth thou shalt teach them the fear of the Lord.
Thou shalt not command thy servant or thy handmaid in thy bitterness, lest they fear not the God who is over both.
In the congregation thou shalt confess thy transgressions, and thou shalt not come to thy prayer with an evil conscience.
This is the way of life. Watch over your life; let not your lamps be quenched, and let not your loins be unloosed.
For the Lord is coming at an hour when you think not. Amen.
